title: First Step - Check Given Values
text:
To calculate the change in enthalpy, first ensure you have all the necessary information. You need:
$$1$$. The moles of ethylene $$(2.00$$ moles).
$$2$$. Heat capacity values from the equipartition theorem.
$$3$$. The temperature range information.

title: Understanding Equipartition Theorem
text: Equipartition theorem states that each degree of freedom contributes $$\frac{1}{2}$$ R to the molar heat capacity. For ethylene, $$C_2 H_4$$, which has both translational and rotational degrees of freedom, consider its contribution to the heat capacity.

title: Calculate Heat Capacity of $$C_2 H_4$$
text:
The heat capacity $$C_p$$ can be calculated knowing the degrees of freedom of $$C_2 H_4$$:
Translational: $$3$$ degrees
Rotational: $$2$$ degrees for linear molecule
Vibrational: Neglect if not specified

Total $$C_p$$ $$=$$ number of degrees * $$ rac{1}{2}$$ R, with R $$=$$ $$8.314$$ $$ rac{J}{mol} K$$.

title: Calculate Change in Enthalpy
text:
Use the formula ΔH $$=$$ $$nC_{p\Delta T}$$ to find the change in enthalpy:
$$n$$ $$=$$ number of moles $$=$$ $$2.00$$ moles
$$C_p$$ $$=$$ heat capacity
ΔT $$=$$ change in temperature range
Insert these values to compute ΔH.
